intro: Ervum pampicola, commonly known as the Pampas bean, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several edible seeds, which are used in local cuisines. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in grasslands and open areas. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and agricultural purposes.
